marketNews.title: Israel Attacks Iran, Oil and Gold Prices Surge
marketNews.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that the Israeli military has launched an attack on Iran, with targets including Iran's nuclear, military, and ballistic missile facilities. This military operation was carried out as a step by Israel to prevent Iran from further developing nuclear weapons. The attack killed the highest commander of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, Hossein Salami, as well as the chief of staff and a senior nuclear scientist. Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, said that Iran would retaliate against the Israeli attack. Meanwhile, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio claimed that the US was not involved in this attack, even though the US already knew the attack would occur. Iran itself is the third largest producer in OPEC+ with production of ~3.3 million barrels per day or equivalent to ~3% of total global production, and sells almost all of its production to China. According to a New York Times report, China has large strategic oil reserves resulting from accumulated purchases over the last decade. This can help China withstand global oil supply disruptions for several weeks. Bloomberg reported that this conflict escalation also raised concerns about Iran's potential to blockade the Strait of Hormuz, which connects about 26% of total global oil trade. The strait is also vital for liquefied natural gas (LNG) trade, with more than one-fifth of global LNG supply passing through this strait. Following the Israeli attack on Iran, Brent crude futures for August 2025 contracts briefly surged up to +13.17% to the level of 78.5 US dollars per barrel on Friday (13/6), before its rise softened to +8.29% this afternoon. On the same day, spot market gold prices also rose up to +1.88% before softening to +1.15% to the level of 3,442 US dollars per troy ounce. Meanwhile, the stock market reacted negatively on Friday (13/6), with Nikkei (-0.92%), Hang Seng (-0.59%), and IHSG (-0.53%) closing weaker, while S&P 500 Futures fell -0.94%.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Following the rise in commodity prices, the shares of oil and gas and gold producers strengthened on Friday (13/6), such as $MEDC (+9.38%), $ENRG (+7.03%), $RATU (+7.39%), $ANTM (+4.10%), $PSAB (+7.00%), and $ARCI (+23.21%). Nevertheless, this rise in commodity prices has the potential to be accompanied by increased volatility, so the development of this conflict needs to be closely monitored by investors.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Projects Retail Sales Growth in May 2025, Yet Contraction MoM
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia estimates that retail sales in May 2025 will grow +2.6% YoY, although still contracting -0.6% MoM. In April 2025, retail sales were recorded at a contraction of -0.3% YoY and -5.1% MoM (vs. Mar 2025: +5.5% YoY, +13.6% MoM), which was better than Bank Indonesia's forecast expecting a contraction of -2.2% YoY and -6.9% MoM. The decline in retail sales in April 2025 was caused by the normalization of public demand following the Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr period.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto Invites Foreign Investors for $80 Billion Seawall Project to Prevent Flooding in North Java
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto openly invited foreign investors to participate in funding the $80 billion seawall project to prevent flooding on the northern coast of Java Island. President Prabowo mentioned that he had invited investors from China and Japan to participate in this project, although he did not elaborate further. The construction of this project is estimated to take 20 years, with the seawall stretching approximately 700 km from Banten to East Java.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto Has No Immediate Plan for Cabinet Reshuffle
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto on Thursday (12/6) stated that he has no intention of conducting a cabinet reshuffle in the near future because he is still satisfied with the performance of his ministers. Previously, rumors of a cabinet reshuffle emerged along with the increasingly intensive meetings between President Prabowo's side and the Chairman of PDI-P, Megawati Soekarnoputri, as well as public scrutiny of a number of ministers who often made controversial statements.

marketNews.title: Indonesia and Singapore Sign MoUs on Low-Carbon Electricity Trade and Carbon Capture Collaboration
marketNews.content: Indonesia and Singapore on Friday (13/6) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to develop low-carbon electricity trade and collaborate on carbon capture and storage projects. Under this MoU, Indonesia and Singapore will draft policies, regulatory frameworks, and business arrangements that will allow Indonesian electricity to be supplied to Singapore. Indonesia and Singapore will also consider drafting a legally binding agreement regarding cross-border carbon capture and storage projects. If realized, this will be the first such project in Asia. The two countries also signed an agreement to develop sustainable industrial areas on several Indonesian islands near Singapore, including Batam, Bintan, and Karimun.

marketNews.title: Minister of Religious Affairs: No Official Discussion from Saudi Arabia on Cutting 2026 Hajj Quota by 50%
marketNews.content: The Minister of Religious Affairs, Nasaruddin Umar, stated on Friday (13/6) that there has been no official discussion from Saudi Arabian authorities regarding the plan to reduce the 2026 Hajj quota by up to 50%. Previously, the Head of the Hajj Organizing Agency, Mochamad Irfan Yusuf, stated on Tuesday (10/6) that Saudi Arabian Hajj authorities were planning to reduce the 2026 Hajj quota by up to 50%.

tickerNews.title: SMRA: Summarecon Agung Marketing Sales +20% YoY in 5M25
tickerNews.content: Summarecon Agung President Director, Adrianto Pitojo Adi, stated that his company recorded marketing sales of 1.8 trillion rupiah during 5M25 (+20% YoY), equivalent to 36% of the 2025 target of 5 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: PTBA: Bukit Asam Prepares Jumbo CAPEX of IDR 7.2 T in 2025 Amid Commodity Fluctuations
tickerNews.content: Bukit Asam Corporate Secretary, Niko Chandra, stated that his company will allocate capital expenditure (capex) of 7.2 trillion rupiah throughout 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: 2.3 trillion rupiah). Niko explained that this sharp increase in capex is driven by the logistics development project currently being undertaken by the company through the enhancement of the Keramasan railway transport line. Meanwhile, PTBA President Director, Arsal Ismail, stated that PTBA still targets coal production of 50 million metric tons in 2025, unchanged from the RKAB despite fluctuating commodity prices.

tickerNews.title: BSSR Explores New Coal Mine Acquisition Opportunity Leveraging Weak Coal Prices
tickerNews.content: Baramulti Suksessarana management announced that the company is exploring new coal mine acquisition opportunities as part of its inorganic growth strategy, taking advantage of the momentum of weakening coal prices. Although the details of the targeted assets were not specified, BSSR management explained that the exploration process has been carried out and will be announced once the results are concrete. BSSR management also added that the company is actively conducting mine exploration, with opened areas from the total new PKP2B reaching only 25% or about 4,000 ha. The company allocated a capex of 25 million US dollars in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 81 million US dollars), with a production target of 18.5 million tons (vs. 2024 realization: 21 million tons).

tickerNews.title: PBSA Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend Payout of IDR 55 per Share
tickerNews.content: Paramita Bangun Sarana shareholders approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 165 billion rupiah or 55 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 77% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 82%) and indicates a dividend yield of 12.4% as of Friday (13/6). The cum date and payment date have not yet been announced. For 2025, PBSA management targets revenue of approximately 1.4 trillion rupiah (vs. 2024 realization: ~1.2 trillion rupiah) and net profit of 202 billion rupiah (vs. 2024 realization: 215 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: SOLA: Xolare RCR Energy Subsidiary Secures ASPHALT Emulsion Contract from Pertamina Hulu Rokan
tickerNews.content: Xolare RCR Energy ($SOLA) announced that its subsidiary, PT Modifikasi Bitumen Sumatera, has secured a contract worth approximately 41 billion rupiah from PT Pertamina Hulu Rokan. The contract covers the supply of CMS-2 type emulsion asphalt totaling 3,800 metric tons.
